DOC.brief_summary: This is a feasibility study of a WrapAround Case Management Program for Youth Injured by Violence. Youth (aged 10-24) who have been injured by violence and visit the emergency department will be offered a support worker who will provide WrapAround Case Management. This study is designed to assess the feasibility of recruitment, enrollment and follow-up.
DOC.brief_title: A WrapAround Case Management Program for Youth Injured by Violence
DOC.criteria: 1. Age 10 24 and 2. Presentation to an ED or trauma floor with an injury caused by violence (defined as an injury inflicted by someone else and one of a gunshot wound, stab wound, injury due to blunt object, or injury due to bodily force). 1. Unable to consent due to language or brain injury, 2. Sexual assault, 3. Child Abuse 4. SelfInflicted Injury, 5. Subject is under arrest or 6. Nonresident of Winnipeg.
